intro: Leptosema uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower leptosema, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats.
